RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 4 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STONE ALLIANCE was sent out for the early lead, was able to secure a rail trip and control the pace, was briefly challenged after the half, but had a lot left in the tank and was able to draw clear, was driven into the stretch and kept to task, and wrapped up after the eighth mile pole. SNEAKY ALLIE KAT was slow into stride, unhurried along the backside, was cued around the half mile pole, responded well making one run along the rail, gaining ground through the turn angled out in the stretch, continued to close was able to get up for second. OLE STUD MUFFIN was rated off the pace shuffled back early, started gaining ground after the half and past the three eighths poles, saved ground through the turn angled out three wide in the stretch and was caught by another foe, battled late, held on for third. DEMON HUNTER was off the pace the pace early, traveled four wide along the backside, hooked company in the lane but didn't finish. R T'S D'ORO was anxious to make the lead early was hung seven wide through the first turn and along the back side, battled in the lane with another competitor but had no rally. FORGED IN STEEL no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Stone Alliance
ENTRY.COMMENT: was sent to the lead, attended the pace, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Ole Stud Muffin
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated off pace, shuffled back, gained ground turn, closed,

ENTRY.NAME: Demon Hunter
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4w, ran flat

ENTRY.NAME: Sneaky Allie Kat
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow into stride, unhurried, moved 1/2, saved ground, up for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Forged in Steel
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor

ENTRY.NAME: R T's d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: hung 7w early, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Starter Allowance Purse 22000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN 2021 - 2023. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since January 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MYFRIENDSAWINNER was squarely bumped by an inner rival into an outer foe's path at the start, stalked three wide and outside of the embattled leading pair, ranged up to bid entering the lane, gained an advantage in upper stretch, inched away to a clear margin in the final sixteenth, and held off an outer bidder late. ZYDECO MUSIC broke a beat slow before taking contact from rivals on both sides at the start, recovered to midpack exiting the opening stages, tucked to the rail entering the turn while inching closer to a stalking position, pursued from the pocket turning for home, shifted out four wide in upper stretch after MYFRIENDISAWINNER got a jump, chased that foe through midstretch, closed in in the final sixteenth to attempt a late bid, but was fended off. OURPERFECTPRINCESS crossed over while striking the front early on, dueled with an outer presser around the turn, got headed by a wider bidder in upper stretch, fought on through midstretch, but yielded in the final sixteenth. GALAXY THIRTYSIX was pinched back when put to tight quarters soon after the start, laid far back in the three path, fanned out to the eight path in upper stretch, and stayed on willingly. NEW YEAR'S PARTY lacked speed in the two path, shifted out to the seven path in upper stretch, and mildly closed in between horses. SHADES OF TRUTH broke outwardly and bumped a rival into other foes at the start, vied two wide around the turn, but weakened between horses in upper stretch. COMMERCIAL FLASH brushed an inner rival at the start, and got outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: New Year's Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2p, 7p upr, stayed on btwn

ENTRY.NAME: Shades of Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out/bumped foe start, vied 2wd, wknd btwn upper

ENTRY.NAME: Myfriendsawinner
ENTRY.COMMENT: slammed start,stalked 3wd,bid 1/4,led upr,inched clear late,held

ENTRY.NAME: Galaxy Thirtysix
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched start, far back 3p, 8p upper, stayed on

ENTRY.NAME: Zydeco Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: beat slow/bumpd btw st,track,ins 7/16,stalk,4w upr,chasd,late bid

ENTRY.NAME: Commercial Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed start, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Ourperfectprincess
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, dueled inside, headed upper, yielded late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Red Camelia S. FAIR GROUNDS RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 94. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD, ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORT POLK eased back from a bit of tight quarters in the early stages, settled off of the pace four wide, inched closer around the far turn, sustained a rally to bid at the furlong grounds, dueled before gaining an advantage in the final sixteenth as an inner A G'S CHARLOTTE menaced, and fended off that foe to the wire. A G'S CHARLOTTE settled off of the pace in the two path, shifted three wide around the far turn, dove inwardly while launching a rally in upper stretch, advanced along the rail to offer a bid in the final sixteenth, but was denied. WHOLELOTTAMO trailed around both turns, swung from the three path to the five path around the far turn, drifted out to the eight path in upper stretch, flopped to and from her left lead while spinning her wheels approaching midstretch, but straightened and offered a belated kick in the outer part of the course in the closing stages, but ran out of ground. CHEAPSKATE DIVA set the pace in the two path, built a clear margin turning for home, dug in to resist an outer challenge in midstretch, and yielded between bidders in the final sixteenth. BLESSED ANNA stalked three wide, pressed down the backstretch, but failed to keep pace with the leader around the far turn, and tired between horses at the three sixteenths pole. FREE LIKE A GIRL bobbled at the start, tracked two wide and between horses, but required coaxing to sustain position down the backstretch, and gave way around the far turn. EVE'S DELIGHT stalked along the inside, and faded around the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Eve's Delight
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, faded 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: A G's Charlotte
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace ins-2p,3w2nd,shifted in upr,rail rally,bid 1/16,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Free Like a Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Bruno Jr Gerald Deville Carl J Pomier Chasey Deville and Caroom Jerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, tracked 2wd btwn, coaxed along, gave way 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Wholelottamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed,3-5p2nd,drifted 8p upr,flopped leads1/8,late kick,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Polk
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4wd,inched closer 2nd,rallied,bid 1/8,dueled,up,held

ENTRY.NAME: Cheapskate Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2p, clear 5/16, dug in 1/8, yielded btwn late

ENTRY.NAME: Blessed Anna
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3wd, pressed, chased 2nd, tired btwn 3/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 24000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES OVER A MILE SINCE SEPTEMBER 4, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 4 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMOKEY HARBOR stalked outside of the top pair and from the four path around the first turn, ranged up to vie at the half mile pole, gained an advantage two wide around the far turn, cleared in four path in upper stretch, drifted out in the closing stages as TAPAGE produced a rail challenge, and narrowly lasted. TAPAGE bobbled slightly at the start, tracked along the inside while just a bit off of the rail, rallied in upper stretch, surpassed an inner rival before bidding inside of the leader in the final sixteenth, but narrowly missed. OTTOTHELEGEND dueled for the lead along the inside, but failed to keep pace with a pair of outer rivals leaving the half mile pole, chased the top pair from the three path around the far turn, lost show to an inner rival in upper stretch, and kept on to regain that position at the wire. SUPER WISE dueled for the lead two wide, cleared an inner rival as an outer foe vied into the far turn, got headed by that rival in upper stretch, and weakened entering the final sixteenth. PAYNT BATTLE pulled while rank in the four to three paths and between horses around the first turn, settled before taking the far turn in the four path and between horses around the far turn, fanned to the seven path in upper stretch, and failed to factor. VIM AND VIGOR lacked speed in the six to five paths, was outrun in the three path around the far turn, and got eased in upper stretch. CLASSIC KING laid off of the pace in the five to four paths and between horses around the far turn, chased in the five path around the far turn, and was eased in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Ottothelegend
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled ins, outpaced ins pair 1/2, chased 3p2nd, outkckd, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Super Wise
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2w-3p, ins foe-rail 2nd, headed upr, wknd 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Smokey Harbor
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalk 3w-4p1st,bid 1/2,vied 2w2nd,cleard upr,drift out late,lastd

ENTRY.NAME: Paynt Battle
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, pull/rank 4-3p btw 1st, 4p btw 2nd, 7p upr, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Tapage
ENTRY.OWNER: Highfield Investment Group Inc and Appleyard Greg
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight bobble st,track ins-2p,rallied 2w3/16,ins bid late,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Classic King
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 5-4p btw1st, chased 5p2nd, eased upper

ENTRY.NAME: Vim and Vigor
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 6-5p1st, trailed 3p2nd, eased upper

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 52000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $13,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f Two Races Since January 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Races Where Entered For $35,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: READY FOR CHANGE settled off the pace early, stalked from the inside through the turn, angled out into the stretch, got clear, was driven hard and closed well, caught the leader late and scored the win. BELEOUT broke a bit behind today, was settled into the second tier from the inside, was rushed after the half to catch the early leader, angled to the outside going into the turn, took command turning for home was angled in and out trying to control the race, but was caught late in deep stretch and tired. MISTY DAY was the quickest out of the gates today, took the early lead and attended the pace from the rail, was challenged by the favorite after the three eighths pole, relinquished the lead and faltered in the stretch. ROOKERY settled early, made a brief run into the turn while being five wide, struggled to switch leads in the stretch and tired. DONYA KNOW IT was never able to get involved today.

ENTRY.NAME: Beleout
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke dull, was rushed to catch the early leader, tired late.

ENTRY.NAME: Ready for Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, angled out in the turn, closed well, up for the win

ENTRY.NAME: Donya Know It
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved today

ENTRY.NAME: Rookery
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief run, 5w, struggled to switch her leads passed tired ones.

ENTRY.NAME: Misty Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, controlled pace, was challenged late, faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Edward J. Johnston Memorial S. FAIR GROUNDS RACE 6 1M Turf CR: 106. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD, ACCREDITED LOUISIANA BRED.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG CHOPPER tracked two wide, then from between horses while just off of the pace around the far turn, patiently bided time turning for home, split foes through a wide opening in the four path in upper stretch, bid, led entering the final furlong, sparred with an outer rival thereafter, and tenaciously held to the wire. WHO TOOK THE MONEY got antsy in the gate while his most immediate inner rival acted up, then brushed the inner half of the gate upon leaving it, laid unhurried in the three path around both turns shifted out to the eight path at the three sixteenths pole, rallied with a good kick in the final furlong to take aim on the top pair nearing the wire, but was too late while gaining place via a head-bob. BUDRO TALKING laid off of the pace three wide, tracked in the four path and outside of the main group around the far turn, spun into the lane in the seven path, offered a grinding charge to bid in midstretch, dueled through the final furlong, but was gamely fended off before getting nailed for place by an outer bidder at the wire. SMARTY ALEX saved ground off of the pace, was patiently handled around the far turn, vacated the inside in upper stretch, and chased in the three path and between horses in the final furlong. WICKED ROSE was fractious in the starting gate causing the need to be backed out and reloaded , trailed in the two to three paths, swung to the seven path entering the lane, and moved up in the outer part of the course in the closing stages. MAGA MAN pressed the leader from the three path, but drifted to the five path entering the lane, sustained a chase between horses in upper stretch, but gave way approaching the furlong grounds. MANGELSEN set the pace in the two path, but was headed in upper stretch, and weakened through the final furlong. HIGHLAND CREEK stalked along the inside, pursued from the pocket around the far turn, and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Smarty Alex
ENTRY.OWNER: Alexis Claire Racing Services LLC and Pohl Dennis
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace ins, saved ground, patient 2nd, chased 3p btwn

ENTRY.NAME: Mangelsen
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2p, headed upper, wknd 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Budro Talking
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3wd,tracked 4p2nd,7p1/4,grind,bid1/8,dueled,denied btw

ENTRY.NAME: Highland Creek
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, pocket 2nd, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate/reloaded, trailed 2-3p, 7p upr, 9p1/8, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: Who Took the Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: antsy,brushed gate,unhurried 3p,8p3/16,late kick,belated,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Maga Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2w-3p, drifted 5p1/4, chased, gave way btwn 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Big Chopper
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2w,btw 2nd,split 4p upr,bid,led,duel 1/8,held tenaciously

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 83. Maiden Special Weight Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $50,000 In Their Last 3 Starts).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BO CRUZ was quickest out of the gates, took the rail trip while attending the pace, was able set comfortable fractions while still on the rail, was challenged by another competitor briefly coming out of the turn, was cued to go and responded by drawing off and was allowed to drift out a bit late, but easily won. DUAL MONARCHY challenged and wanted to match strides with the early leader from the two path, was cued to take the lead after the five sixteenths pole but wasn't able to take or stay with the leader but was able to hold on for second. RULE BREAKER was off a bit tardy, settled behind the leaders from the rail, was patient while waiting for room, was given room to move out coming out of the turn, was given the cue to go on but ran flat. PRESIDER was right behind the leaders saving ground early, moved up in between foes in the four path after the half, chased down the lane and tired. GATLINBURG was six wide going into and through the first turn, traveled four wide down the backstretch from mid pack, was still wide into the second turn and into the stretch, where he faded late. SILVER BULL races four wide and was through after the half.

ENTRY.NAME: Bo Cruz
ENTRY.COMMENT: took the lead, played with the pace, took command, easy win

ENTRY.NAME: Dual Monarchy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2wd, bid 5/16, no match 1/4, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Rule Breaker
ENTRY.OWNER: Spendthrift Farm LLC Steve Landers Racing LLC Schwartz M Dubb M Ten Strike Racin
ENTRY.COMMENT: was off a bit slow, stalked behind the leaders, let out, ran flat

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Bull
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Saints or Sinners Abernathy Robert and Abernathy DeLynn
ENTRY.COMMENT: was through after the half.

ENTRY.NAME: Presider
ENTRY.OWNER: Iapetus Racing LLC and Diamond T Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Gatlinburg
ENTRY.OWNER: Poindexter Thoroughbreds LLC and Montanye Susan
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 5-4w1st, inside 1/2, saved ground 2nd, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Black Gold S. FAIR GROUNDS RACE 8 1 1/16M Turf CR: 100. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. Free nomination by Saturday, February 18. $375 to enter, $375 additional to start. Supplemental nominations of $1,500 will be accepted at time of entry which shall include all fees. $75,000 Guaranteed of which 60% to the winner, 20% t o second, 10% to third, 4% to fourth, 2% to fifth and 1% to finishers sixth through ninth. Weight: 122 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstakes at a mile or over on the turf allowed 2 lbs. $45,000 at a mile or over on the turf allowed 4 lbs (Maiden, claiming an d starter races not considered in estimating allowances.) Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. The maximum field size for the Black Gold Stakes will be determined by rail setting. Preference to horses with the highest t otal earnings on the turf. Any horse excluded from running because of the aforementioned preference will be refunded the entry fee or supplementary nomination fee if applicable. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, February 1
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WONDERFUL JUSTICE (GB) bobbled a touch while bumping with an inner rival at the start, stalked two wide, took aim on the clear leader from the four path in upper stretch, grinded away in midstretch to bid entering the final sixteenth, wrestled an advantage in the closing stages, and lasted from an outer oncharging rival to the wire. MYREDWHITEANDBLUE rated at the rear two wide, lagged turning for home, fanned out to the outer part of the course in upper stretch, and offered a stout late kick to miss reeling in the leader at the wire. RECKONING FORCE set the pace along the inside, cleared off to an open advantage with five furlongs to go, maintained that margin turning for home, held sway through midstretch while hanging on his left lead, but drifted out while getting collared entering the final sixteenth, and gave in late. ANDTHEWINNERIS was squarely bumped by rivals on both sides at the start, laid off of the pace along the inside, split foes while shifting out turning for home, took aim from the seven path in upper stretch, rallied into midstretch, but flattened out entering the final sixteenth, and got outkicked for a minor placing late. MAZING MARK broke out and bumped a foe at the start before being pushed back inwardly in the after math, settled far back along the inside, produced a grinding charge two wide in upper stretch in hopes of bidding inside of the leaders in the late stages, but flattened out. LORD DONEGAL leaned in and bumped a foe at the start, laid off of the pace two wide, attempted to gain four to five wide around the far turn, but failed to menace through the lane. WINTERS LION bobbled at the start, tracked three wide, but faltered between horses nearing the lane. TAPIO bumped with an outer rival at the start, tracked along the inside, chased around the far turn, and caved.

ENTRY.NAME: Reckoning Force
ENTRY.OWNER: Qatar Racing LLC Detampel Marc and Galvin Fergus
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace,cleared off 5/8,left lead,collared/drift out1/16,gave in

ENTRY.NAME: Tapio
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, tracked inside, chased 2nd, caved

ENTRY.NAME: Wonderful Justice (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled/bumpd start,stalked 2wd,aim 4p upr,grind,bid 1/16,up,held

ENTRY.NAME: Mazing Mark
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out/bump/pushed in st,far back ins,grind 2wd upr,flattend out

ENTRY.NAME: Andthewinneris
ENTRY.COMMENT: slammd btw st,off pace ins,split 3p5/16,aim 7pupr,flattnd/outkckd

ENTRY.NAME: Lord Donegal
ENTRY.COMMENT: leaned in/bump start, off pace 2w, 4-5w2nd, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Winters Lion
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, tracked 3wd, faltered 3-4wd btwn 5/16

ENTRY.NAME: Myredwhiteandblue
ENTRY.OWNER: Powell Bennett E and Roussel III Louie J
ENTRY.COMMENT: at rear 2wd, lagged behind, 10p3/16, late surge, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 4, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 4 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $5,000, allowed 2 lb s.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET VISTA stalked the clear leader from the two path, bid turning for home, took over in upper stretch, and drew off under a drive. BIG BELLA BROWN cleared off early on, but offered little resistance to an outer rival's bid entering the lane, and was second best. IZZY'S BABY BOY chased the top pair from the three path, and safely managed show. STEAL IT BACK saved ground far back, and improved inside of rivals in the final furlong for a minor share. MR. PRIORITY lacked speed in the four path, and made little impact. RIFLE MAN tossed his head at the start, raced at the rear in the three path, and never got involved. AFLEET ASCENT laid off of the pace while off of the rail, and tired between horses entering the final sixteenth.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Bella Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: cleared early, no match 1/4, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Vista
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2p, bid 2w5/16, took over upper, drew off, driving

ENTRY.NAME: Afleet Ascent
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace ins-2p, tired btwn 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Steal It Back
ENTRY.COMMENT: far back inside, saved ground, improved 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4p, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Rifle Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head start, far back 3p, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Izzy's Baby Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3p, best of rest
